intro: Hieracium hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium hispanicum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it adapts well to poor soil conditions.
